# CELLM

> **Stop repeating yourself. AI that remembers your project.**

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ab475e0a-27d1-44e4-886e-261b96839027)



**The Problem:** You waste 70% of every AI session re-explaining your stack, patterns, and rules.

**The Solution:** CELLM loads your project's knowledge automatically. Work with AI that already knows how you code.

**The Result:** 3-5x faster development. Consistent code. Zero repetition.

[![Install](https://img.shields.io/badge/Install-Now-blue.svg)](#quick-start)
[![Version](https://img.shields.io/badge/version-2.0.5-blue.svg)](https://github.com/murillodutt/cellm/releases)
[![License](https://img.shields.io/badge/license-MIT-green.svg)](../LICENSE)
[![Free](https://img.shields.io/badge/100%25-Free_Forever-brightgreen.svg)](#)

---

## What You Get

‚ö° **3-5x Faster Development** - AI already knows your stack (Nuxt 4, Vue 3, TypeScript, Tailwind)

üéØ **Consistent Quality** - 50+ validated patterns loaded automatically

üöÄ **Zero Configuration** - Install once, works immediately

üìÅ **Documentation Maintenance (DocOps Plugin)** - Optional plugin for LLM-first docs, code evidence, and drift control

üíé **100% Free Forever** - Professional tooling, MIT licensed, no strings attached

[Learn more about features ‚Üí](docs/FEATURES.md)

---

## Quick Start (60 seconds)

```bash
# 1. Add marketplace (first time only)
/plugin marketplace add murillodutt/cellm

# 2. Install the plugin
/plugin install cellm

# 3. Verify it's working
/oracle-status

# 4. Start building (in Claude Code session)
"create a new Nuxt component with Tailwind"
```

**That's it.** AI now knows your project.

[Detailed installation guide ‚Üí](docs/INSTALLATION.md)
